sense.name: an amount of physical product or commodity
sense.commentary: YIELD[+quantity][+product] Note: tangible goods, an amount of a commodity
sense.examples: The yield from my apple tree this year was three barrels. The farmers had a very low yield because of the prolonged drought. Potential yields of sweet crude from this region of land make the cost of exploration worthwhile.

sense.name: the payoff or return of a financial investment
sense.examples: The yield to maturity on those bonds is only 3 per cent. John expects higher yields from his overseas investments. The yield curve indicates a strong economic quarter ahead.

sense.name: the measure of production capacity over time
sense.commentary: YIELD[+quantity][+capacity] Note: a measure of production over time
sense.examples: The yield of that old mill is only half of what the new one can achieve. A contaminant in our clean room was responsible for the yield reduction of microchips. They increased the yield by putting three shifts on the assembly line.
